v1: And still in loneliness she waits,
And still in robes of widowhood,
v2: Has lived, and loved and died,
And as they left us one by one,
We laid them side by side;
We laid them down to sleep,
We laid them but to ripen there
v3: The pow'rs of hell grow bold,
The conflict thickens, faith is low,
How long, O Lord our God,
Will You not judge Your suff'ring Church,
Her sighs, and tears, and blood?
v4: We long to hear Your voice,
To see You face to face,
To share Your crown and glory then,
As now we share Your grace.
Should she not wear the signs of grief
v5: And waits to hear that voice
The curse, the sin, the stain,
And make this blighted world of ours
